nodes.bodyText:
why start with -1?
Also in terms of functionality, do not allow deleting the last line/last col (TB has at least one cell, add in precondition of remove line/col that num lines and cols > 1 to be able to delete.

this function works only for Element TB. For diagram TB is not used?
rename the function to a more suggestive name: getTitleBlockNumColumns maybe and support also the Diagram TB type.
rename to a more suggestive name: getTitleBlockNumLines maybe
only constans in upper case. rename this variable, cammel case. (eAnnotationPresent)
This is not the condition to determine if it's a diagram or not. For diagram title block, the container must be the diagram. For element title block, the container must be an EdgeTarget.

First, the name of the method is really misleading. The method checks whether the elementView has at least 1 title block attached to it. It should be something like hasElementTitleBlock
Second, if elementView is always DDiagramElement, its parent diagram can be obtained from it, no need to pass as parameter.
why DNodeList?
why DNodeList?
if you wanna say the target is not a TitleBlock, you must check the source of the DAnnotation. And why not create a helper to check whether a DAnnotation/a diagram element is a TitleBlock?
Why IS_ELEMENT_TITLE_BLOCK is repeated in annotationCol and annotation itself?
Does the method mean "I do not have any attached diagram title block"?
How can this happen?
Could you use/complete the helper org.polarsys.capella.core.diagram.helpers.DAnnotationHelper to code things related to DAnnotation?
Could you use helper methods? Like this, it's really hard to follow. For example: getAllTitleBlockFromDiagram, getAllTitleBlockLineFromTilteBlock, etc.

Really, either you put comments to explain more or you break the code down to more understandable methods, like this it's really hard to follow. For example, this could be something like: getAllTitleBlockLines. The code should not only work but also maintainable.
I do not understand the name of this method.
Similarly, this code is not maintainable. It must be something like deleteAllCells and then deleteAllLine, right?

There are important points to this approach:

Do we need to temporary TB_CONTENT annotation to store the result of the queries? Could you try to use the TitleBlockCell itself as the domain object of the node and inteprete the content on the fly?
Not only Strings are stored in these DT_TitleBlockCellNode. We have to support the query that returns a list of object. For example: feature:ownedPropertyValues. This is the basic use case and must be implemented.
For Show/Hide part, why do we need to use the attribute VISIBILITY to verify that a title block is visible or not? In other diagrams, we do not need this attribute to do Show/Hide.
